author: ncitron
content: Is the networking and consensus for DVT well specified enough so that different implementations can be used in the same validator (for example a distributed node with half running obol and the other half running ssv)?

author: okyne
content: Right now the two implementations are not compatible with one another but at some point both hope to have multiple independent interoperable clients

author: ncitron
content: Is there a reason why the two haven't come together to standardize? Increased interop between them (and others) seems like a good goal

author: okyne
content: We at obol went the route of implementing Obol as a distributed validator middleware that allows the existing validator clients to operate together as a distributed validator. The specs right now entail creating a standalone validator client. You can read more about our approach here https://ethresear.ch/t/distributed-validator-middlewares-and-the-aggregation-duty/13044

author: alon.ssv.network
content:
There is an emerging EF spec but it’s far from complete.
SSV has a pretty complete spec detailed here

https://github.com/bloxapp/ssv-spec

author: alon.ssv.network
content: Current EF spec uses a remote signer approach and doesn’t require any ethereum spec/ standard changes
